instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck at 20V 100mA
threads.message:
I have a Liquid damage board around <CHIP>U7230</CHIP>, Power button, <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> areas.
Cleaned all corrosion (minor) and replaced <RESISTOR>R4922</RESISTOR>.
20V on usbc meter with 100-95mA  on all ports.
With battery current draw is only 500-700mA however battery seems a little bit inflated...

P1V1SLPS2R_FB 1.1V
P1V1SLPS2R_SW0 1.1V
P1V1SLPS2R_SW1 1.1V
P1V8SLPS2R_SW0 1.8V
<SIGNAL>P1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR_R</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 0.8V
<SIGNAL>PP1V25_SLPS2R_SMC_AVREF</SIGNAL> 1.25V
<SIGNAL>SOC_RED_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> NC

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12,56V during 14 secondes and 12,32V during 4 secondes
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> 5V during 14 secondes and 3v during 4 secondes

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> 3,3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> 1.V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_REG_R</SIGNAL> 3.3V

It enters DFU but no revive neither restore worked.

No idea what to check, I am also going to try with a another battery if i recall this model needs a battery in order to boot...

threads.title: liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck at 20V 100mA
threads.message:
Apart of <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>5V_G3S</SIGNAL>, do you note voltage (or pulse at least), on any other big coil?

What about SSD voltages?
Pay atention to <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> side.

threads.title: liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck at 20V 100mA
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos,

<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is steady 3.3V , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12,56V during 14 secondes and 12,32V during 4 secondes, <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> 5V during 14 secondes and 3v during 4 secondes

Only L7030 <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE1</SIGNAL>/2 8.6V during 14 secondes and 11,2V during 4 secondes
No other voltage (even a pulse) appears in any other big coil.

As per SSD voltages they are all missing
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> 0V, with 0,50 diode mode
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> 0V, with 0,250 diode mode
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> 0V, with 0,384 diode mode

I replaced <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> where i found a little bit of crap under but nothing changed...

threads.title: liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck at 20V 100mA
threads.message:
Reflash SoC ROM and try again DFU.
You can also try just erasing it.
